comments:
The compiler crashed on a simple test case; I will send this in a separate 
email. This crash still occurs in the version from CVS head as of 9/8/03. I 
believe the first error message is also a compiler bug - it should be possible 
to use declare soft on a non-concrete pointcut.

1 fail|abort, 3 errors

I believe this should be fixed by the same changes that fixed your two related
declare error and declare soft bug reports.  Please confirm that this is fixed
for you in CVS head, and reopen the bug if you still see the NPE.

The following program demonstrates a related NPE, resulting from a derived 
class that doesn't implement an abstract pointcut. This is less serious, since 
it is caused by an invalid program.

source:
public abstract aspect Base {
    public abstract pointcut scope();
    declare soft: Exception: scope();
}

aspect Derived extends Base {
}

example output (from cvs head):

1 fail|abort, 1 error

Using the test code supplied in comment #3 I do not see the NPE but, instead, 
see the following (logical) compiler errors :-

* inherited abstract pointcut Base.scope() is not made concrete in Derived
* pointcut Base.scope() is abstract
* inherited abstract pointcut Base.scope() is not made concrete in Derived

which go away when a concrete version of the pointcut is supplied in the Derived 
aspect. Is this still a bug ?
This was probably fixed some time in the tree.
updating target flag to indicate inclusion in 1.2 release.
